other_tests.findings: Turbid urine with 6 to 8 white cells per high-power field; initially revealed 6 to 8 white cells per high power field, later showed 2 to 4 white cells per high power field.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Decreased white cell count from 6 to 8 to 2 to 4 white cells per high power field.

other_tests.date: Two and a half weeks before admission
other_tests.findings: Hepatomegaly with multiple hypodense nodules in the spleen and liver.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT two months later showed nearly complete resolution of the lesions in the liver and spleen.

other_tests.findings: Chronic lymphocytic inflammation extending across the limiting plate of an adjacent hepatic lobule with extracellular bacilli visualized by Warthinâ€“Starry silver stain.
IgG titers to B. henselae and B. quintana exceeded 1:1024; IgM titers were less than the assay threshold of 1:20.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up testing showed IgG titers remained positive at greater than 1:1024, and B. henselae IgM antibody titer increased to 1:80.
